sense.name: a state of annoyance, a bother
sense.commentary: HARASSMENT[+state][+annoyance][+extreme] Note: a subject experiences annoyance, no implied object Note: nominalization corresponds to a predicate 'my harassment grew' -> 'I grew harassed', 'her harassment at seeing him' 'she BE harassed at seeing him'
sense.examples: Her harassment at having to pick us up at the airport was evident on her face. My harassment grew as the minutes passed and I remained on hold. The harassments of holiday shopping and entertaining put Mary in a cranky mood.

sense.name: the activity of molesting or mistreating someone
sense.commentary: HARASSMENT[+activity][+mistreatment][+molestation] Note: a subject/agent bothers a patient/object Note: nominalization corresponds to transitive verb - 'his harassment of the prisoner' -> 'he harassed the prisoner'
sense.examples: He resigned from the senate after being accused of sexual harassment. The harassment of new prisoners by other inmates was a fact of life there. Harassment of any wildlife in this nature preserve is against the law.
